FuncDef:
The nat ip access-user limit command sets the maximum number of private network users sharing the same public IP address in PAT mode.
The undo nat ip access-user limit command deletes the maximum number of private network users sharing the same public IP address in PAT mode.
By default, the number of private network users sharing the same public IP address in PAT mode is not limited.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the maximum number of private network users who can share a public IP address to get online.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4096.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The nat ip access-user limit command is mainly used in dynamic port allocation, semi-dynamic port allocation, and per-port allocation scenarios. In these scenarios, multiple private network users share a public IP address for access. If the number of access users of a private network is too large, the new users cannot access the port. As a result, the traffic of some private network users cannot be forwarded. By limiting the number of online users on a single public IP address, users are allocated to each public IP address to prevent multiple users from accessing the same public IP address.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The nat ip access-user limit and nat bind static-mapping commands are mutually exclusive.
